segments.text: I see a woman in the kitchen, seemingly lost in her task of drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is so intense that she doesn’t notice the water spilling over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little surprised at how oblivious she is to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle underneath her foot is growing bigger, yet she stands there, unaffected by the world flooding around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a strange mix of calm and chaos, where she embodies routine while danger lurks below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to something, and I can sense the excitement brewing between them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is teetering on that stool, and I fear for him as he leans toward the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister watches with eager anticipation, her hand open as if she’s already claiming a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think if only the woman could look up, she might see the precariousness of the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if time stands still, yet the kitchen is a ticking time bomb of mishaps waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
